data.title: Ilkley Civic Society
data.text:
Blue plaques

Ilkley Civic Society Blue Plaques

Blue Plaques were first erected in London in 1867 and are now in most historic towns.

The Civic Society's blue plaque scheme is to celebrate the history of Ilkley and the buildings that have shaped the town..

June 10th 2004 the Town Hall, Station Road unveiled by Alan Titchmarsh

sponsored by Ilkley Parish Council and Bradford MDC

July 16th 2004 on The Manor House, Castle Yard by Ann Cryer MP.

sponsored by The Friends of the Manor House

Friday 24th June 2005 Wells House in Darwin Gardens by Cllr Anne Hawksworth

sponsored by Magellan

sponsored by Erkulis

Monday July 17th 2006 4pm Grove House – Abbeyfield, Riddings Road by Ann Cryer MP

sponsored by Ilkley Parish Council, Ilkley Civic Society & Brewster Bye

sponsored by Burley Developments

sponsored by Ilkley Parish Council, Ilkley Civic Society & Ilkley Players

sponsored by Chapel House Management Co & ICS

sponsored by Remstone / Valedown

sponsored by Michael Eaton & ICS Press_release_Loxleigh.pdf

You can also see a list of the Blue Plaques with a map showing where they are at:

https://www.ilkleymanorhouse.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/ICS-list-of-Ilkley-Blue-Plaques-.pdf

Ilkley Civic Society has a blue plaque scheme to celebrate the history of Ilkley and buildings that have shaped the town. The scheme is modelled on the familiar blue plaques which appear in London, Leeds and other places.

The Ilkley scheme started in 2004 with two blue plaques - the Town Hall unveiled by Alan Titchmarsh and Ilkley Manor House unveiled by Ann Cryer MP.
